text: Bottle at Legacy Liquor, VancouverVery pale color. The aroma has some anise, alcohol, not much fruit. The mouthfeel is soft, alcohol flavor, persimmon, drier in the final.Not the best one.
Bottle - Lots of pear and melon and touch of booze.Almost completely clear. Sweet, rich mouthfeel and melon. Heavy and boozy. Not delicate.

15.08.2015, 1,8l bottle sampled @ The Tatami Room, Barcelona:
Very light straw colored. Aroma is mild rice aroma, with hints of hay, yeast and some fruits. Taste is slightly dry, yet kind of mild with a round rice flavor, hay, minerals, yeast. Nice warming mild boozy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

A bit fruitier in terms of citrus than most other Sakes. Very popular and generally pretty low priced due to this.

Otherwise some melon and some alcohol. Solid if not super interesting outside of the strong citrus note.

Semi-recommended for fans of heffweizen.

720ml bottle. Pours clear with a hint of pale yellow and no head. Aroma is rice and mellow melon fruity. Taste is rice, melon, with dry warming slightly earthy alcohol. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, no carbonation, warming finish. Quite drinkable.
Glass in an Okonomiyaki restaurant in Shinjuku. Aroma is boozy, taste is better, but still lots of alcohol. Lightly fruity. Ive had better I think. Bit teeth coating.
Pour at Yamaguchis. Warm. Wine peach and bit of alcohol present in the overall taste. Very nice overall.

720ml. my fist Saké ever. absolutely clear in the glass, the nose is very fruity (pears, fresh apples, melon, probably banana). The Saké starts dry, fruity, clean. The main part is very fresh and full with fresh fruit aromas like green apples, melons, just like the nose. At the end there appears a bit warming alcohol. The fruityness stays very long till the end of the long aftertaste. 
--> very interesting!!
11/10/11/11
Appearance clear. Aroma of melon  taste Like a liqour on the strong side almost bitter with stripng overtones
From a 720 ml bottle shared at Tachibana McLean VA.  Pours crystal clear.  Fruity aroma.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Delicate flavors.  Very nice.

From bottle at Standing Bar in Kurumu, courtesy of the three physicians, specifically the retired department head. Paired with "the organ than human doesnt have but chicken does." Probably the tastiest sake of the day, light, fruity and smooth.
Poured from the 1.8 liter bottle. Lightly fruity nose, rice, a bit bland. Shiny and clear. Fruity, estery flavor, melon, rice, koji. Clean and grainy. Good.
Available at Robataya Restaurant.  A mild and pleasant sake, listed as one of the 5 most popular in Japan.  Smooth and lightly sweet with hints of lychee and rice.
UPDATED: DEC 18, 2011 Aroma is melon. Tast has some lemon sourness. This sake has the alcohol less well hidden than the Kubota Hekiju. Its less smooth as well.

fenutin restaurant, american village in okinawa; served cold / light, dry, smooth, and a bit sweet; like a cool, very light, floral lemon tea with a bit of plum. delicious, and dangerously easy to drink. i drank my ice water and poured the rest of the sake into the glass... aaah, with a bit more variety of fruit, perhaps, peach or cherry, with some tartness.. and we have a real winner.
